title: P01-1056

sentences.text: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches .
In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments .
In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners .
We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Entity-this_paper.label: this paper
Entity-this_paper.description: This paper presents an experimental evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system, comparing its performance against various hand-crafted and rule-based generation components.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.label: hand-crafted template-based generation component
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_gener.description: The hand-crafted template-based generation component refers to a manually designed system that generates natural language utterances using predefined templates, which is evaluated in comparison to other sentence planning approaches in a spoken dialogue system.

Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.label: trainable sentence planner
Entity-trainable_sentence_planner.description: A trainable sentence planner is an algorithmic component designed to generate coherent and contextually appropriate sentences in natural language processing applications, particularly within dialogue systems.

Entity-trainable_component.label: trainable components
Entity-trainable_component.description: Trainable components refer to software modules within a natural language generation system that can be automatically trained to produce utterances, specifically in the context of a trainable sentence planner evaluated against traditional hand-crafted and rule-based approaches.

Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.label: rule-based sentence planners
Entity-rule-based_sentence_planner.description: Rule-based sentence planners are computational systems that generate natural language sentences by applying predefined linguistic rules and templates to organize and structure content.

Entity-two_rule-based_sentence_planner.label: two rule-based sentence planners
Entity-two_rule-based_sentence_planner.description: The term 'two rule-based sentence planners' refers to two distinct systems designed to generate sentences based on predefined rules, which are evaluated in comparison to other sentence generation methods in the context of a spoken dialogue system.

Entity-hand-crafted_system.label: hand-crafted system
Entity-hand-crafted_system.description: The 'hand-crafted system' refers to a template-based generation component used in natural language processing that relies on predefined rules and templates to produce utterances, as opposed to being generated through automated training methods.

Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.label: hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches
Entity-hand-crafted_template-based_or_ru.description: Hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches refer to traditional methods in natural language generation that utilize predefined templates or explicit rules to construct utterances, contrasting with automated or trainable systems.

Entity-the_quality_of_utterance_produced.label: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components
aliases: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components
Entity-the_quality_of_utterance_produced.description: The quality of utterances produced with trainable components refers to the effectiveness and naturalness of sentences generated by automated systems that utilize machine learning techniques, as compared to those created through traditional hand-crafted methods.

mentions.local_name: the quality of utterances produced with trainable components

Entity-two_baseline_sentence_planner.label: two baseline sentence planners
Entity-two_baseline_sentence_planner.description: The term 'two baseline sentence planners' refers to two specific sentence planning systems used as reference points in an experimental evaluation of a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system, aimed at comparing their performance against other generation components.

Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.label: baseline sentence planners
Entity-baseline_sentence_planner.description: Baseline sentence planners refer to a category of sentence generation systems used as a standard for comparison in evaluating the performance of other sentence planners, particularly in the context of natural language processing.

Entity-technique_for_automatically_train.label: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator
aliases: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator
Entity-technique_for_automatically_train.description: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator refer to methods designed to enhance the performance of natural language generation systems by enabling them to learn from data rather than relying solely on predefined templates or rules.

mentions.local_name: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator

Entity-rule-based_approach.label: rule-based approaches
Entity-rule-based_approach.description: Rule-based approaches are methodologies that utilize predefined rules and templates to generate outputs or make decisions in various applications, particularly in natural language processing.

Entity-an_exhaustive_comparison.label: an exhaustive comparison
Entity-an_exhaustive_comparison.description: An exhaustive comparison refers to a comprehensive evaluation that includes multiple approaches to natural language generation, specifically assessing a trainable sentence planner against a hand-crafted template-based generation component, two rule-based sentence planners, and two baseline sentence planners.

Entity-natural_language_generator.label: natural language generator
Entity-natural_language_generator.description: A natural language generator is a type of software technology that automatically produces human-like text based on input data, often used in language processing applications.

Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.label: spoken dialogue system
Entity-spoken_dialogue_system.description: A spoken dialogue system is an interactive computer system designed to communicate with users through natural language speech, enabling users to engage in conversation and perform tasks using voice commands.

Entity-quality_of_utterance.label: quality of utterances
Entity-quality_of_utterance.description: The 'quality of utterances' refers to an evaluation metric that assesses the effectiveness and naturalness of spoken or written outputs generated by natural language processing systems, particularly in comparison to traditional hand-crafted methods.

Entity-quality.label: quality
Entity-quality.description: The term 'quality' refers to the evaluation metric used to assess the effectiveness and acceptability of utterances generated by trainable components in comparison to those produced by traditional hand-crafted or rule-based methods.

Entity-rule-based_system.label: rule-based systems
Entity-rule-based_system.description: Rule-based systems are computational systems that use predefined rules to process information and make decisions, often employed in artificial intelligence and expert systems.

Entity-utterance.label: utterances
Entity-utterance.description: Utterances refer to the spoken or written expressions produced during communication, often analyzed in the context of language generation and linguistic output.

Entity-subjective_human_judgment.label: subjective human judgments
Entity-subjective_human_judgment.description: Subjective human judgments refer to evaluations or assessments made by individuals based on personal opinions, feelings, or interpretations rather than objective criteria.

Entity-human_judgment.label: human judgments
Entity-human_judgment.description: Human judgments refer to evaluations or assessments made by individuals based on personal opinions, feelings, or perceptions rather than objective criteria.

Entity-baseline.label: baselines
Entity-baseline.description: Baselines refer to standard reference points or comparison systems used to evaluate the performance of other systems or algorithms in a given task.

summary: Techniques for automatically training modules of a natural language generator have recently been proposed , but a fundamental concern is whether the quality of utterances produced with trainable components can compete with hand-crafted template-based or rule-based approaches . In this paper We experimentally evaluate a trainable sentence planner for a spoken dialogue system by eliciting subjective human judgments . In order to perform an exhaustive comparison , we also evaluate a hand-crafted template-based generation component , two rule-based sentence planners , and two baseline sentence planners . We show that the trainable sentence planner performs better than the rule-based systems and the baselines , and as well as the hand-crafted system .

Predicate-have_been_proposed.label: have been proposed
Predicate-have_been_proposed.description: The predicate 'have been proposed' indicates that the subject has been suggested or recommended as a potential solution, method, or idea related to the object. It implies that there is a consideration or advocacy for the subject in the context of achieving, implementing, or understanding the object.

Predicate-can_compete_with.label: can compete with
Predicate-can_compete_with.description: The predicate 'can compete with' indicates a relationship where the subject possesses qualities, capabilities, or performance levels that are comparable to those of the object. It suggests that the subject is able to match or rival the object in effectiveness, efficiency, or other relevant metrics, implying a level of parity or equivalence in their respective domains.

Predicate-is_a_concern_for.label: is a concern for
Predicate-is_a_concern_for.description: The predicate 'is a concern for' establishes a relationship where the subject is identified as an issue or matter of importance that affects or is relevant to the object. It implies that the subject has implications or significance that warrant attention or consideration in relation to the object.

Predicate-evaluates.label: evaluates
Predicate-evaluates.description: The predicate 'evaluates' signifies an assessment or analysis performed by the subject on the object. It indicates that the subject is examining, measuring, or determining the quality, effectiveness, or performance of the object in a systematic manner.

Predicate-is_for.label: is for
Predicate-is_for.description: The predicate 'is for' indicates a purpose or intended use of the subject in relation to the object. It establishes a connection where the subject is designed, developed, or utilized to serve the needs or functions associated with the object.

Predicate-elicits.label: elicits
Predicate-elicits.description: The predicate 'elicits' indicates an action or process by which the subject provokes, draws out, or stimulates a response, reaction, or information from the object. It suggests an interactive relationship where the subject actively engages with the object to generate a specific outcome or feedback.

Predicate-performs_better_than.label: performs better than
Predicate-performs_better_than.description: The predicate 'performs better than' establishes a comparative relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject exhibits superior performance, effectiveness, or efficiency in a specific context or task when compared to the object. This comparison suggests that the subject achieves more favorable outcomes, results, or capabilities than the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' indicates a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject represents a specific concept or category that falls under the more general category represented by the object. This relationship suggests that the object encompasses a wider range of instances or characteristics than the subject, thereby providing a broader context or classification for understanding the subject.
